intro: Baskervilla paranaensis, commonly known as the Paranaensis Baskervilla, is a flowering plant native to the subtropical regions of Brazil. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. It typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in partial to full sunlight. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
